intro: Conringia australis, commonly known as the Southern Coneflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to thrive in various environments.
